segment_metadata.text_summary: This passage from 1 Corinthians addresses the importance of unity and warns against division within the Christian community. It begins by emphasizing the spiritual gifts and blessings bestowed upon the believers through Christ. The apostle Paul then pleads for unity, urging them to speak with one voice and avoid factions. He expresses concern over reports of quarreling and identifies the formation of groups aligning themselves with different leaders (Paul, Apollos, Cephas, and Christ). Paul rebukes this division, highlighting that Christ was not divided and that baptism is into Christ, not into individual leaders. He clarifies his role as primarily a preacher of the Gospel, not a baptizer, lest the cross of Christ be emptied of its power. The passage concludes by contrasting worldly wisdom with the power of God, proclaiming that the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing but the power of God to those who are being saved. It emphasizes that God has chosen the foolish things of the world to shame the wise.
